trans-unit.source: Register for Azure Active Directory authentication | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Register for Azure Active Directory authentication | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to register for Azure Active Directory authentication in your Mobile Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to register for Azure Active Directory authentication in your Mobile Services application.

trans-unit.source: Register your apps to use an Azure Active Directory Account login
trans-unit.target: Register your apps to use an Azure Active Directory Account login

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Registering your app
trans-unit.target: Registering your app

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps outlined in this topic are intended to be used with [Add Authentication to your Mobile Services app](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-universal-dotnet-get-started-users.md) tutorial when you want to use [Service-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn283952.aspx) with your app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps outlined in this topic are intended to be used with [Add Authentication to your Mobile Services app](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-universal-dotnet-get-started-users.md) tutorial when you want to use [Service-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn283952.aspx) with your app.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if your app has a requirement for [client-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx) for Azure Active Directory and a .NET backend mobile service you should start with the [Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On](mobile-services-windows-store-dotnet-adal-sso-authentication.md) tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, if your app has a requirement for [client-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx) for Azure Active Directory and a .NET backend mobile service you should start with the [Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On](mobile-services-windows-store-dotnet-adal-sso-authentication.md) tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure classic portal], navigate to your mobile service, click the **Identity** tab, then scroll down to the **Azure active directory** identity provider section and copy the **App URL** shown there.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure classic portal], navigate to your mobile service, click the **Identity** tab, then scroll down to the **Azure active directory** identity provider section and copy the **App URL** shown there.

trans-unit.source: ![Mobile service app URL for AAD](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-copy-app-url-waad-auth.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Mobile service app URL for AAD](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-copy-app-url-waad-auth.png)

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [classic portal], click your directory then **Domains** and make a note of your directory's default domain.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [classic portal], click your directory then **Domains** and make a note of your directory's default domain.

trans-unit.source: Click **Applications** > **Add** > **Add an application my organization is developing**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Applications** > **Add** > **Add an application my organization is developing**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Web application and/or Web API** type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Web application and/or Web API** type.

trans-unit.source: ![Name your AAD app](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-add-app-wizard-1-waad-auth.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Name your AAD app](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-add-app-wizard-1-waad-auth.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **Sign-on URL** box, paste the app URL value you copied from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the **Sign-on URL** box, paste the app URL value you copied from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Enter the same unique value in the **App ID URI** box, then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Enter the same unique value in the **App ID URI** box, then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: ![Set the AAD app properties](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-add-app-wizard-2-waad-auth.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Set the AAD app properties](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-active-directory-authentication/mobile-services-add-app-wizard-2-waad-auth.png)

trans-unit.source: After the application has been added, click the **Configure** tab and copy the **Client ID** for the app.
trans-unit.target: After the application has been added, click the **Configure** tab and copy the **Client ID** for the app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For a .NET backend mobile service, you must also edit the **Reply URL** value under **Single Sign-on** to be the URL of your mobile service appended with the path, _signin-aad_.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For a .NET backend mobile service, you must also edit the **Reply URL** value under **Single Sign-on** to be the URL of your mobile service appended with the path, _signin-aad_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-aad`
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-aad`

trans-unit.source: Return to your mobile service's **Identity** tab and paste the copied **Client ID** value for the azure active directory identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Return to your mobile service's **Identity** tab and paste the copied **Client ID** value for the azure active directory identity provider.

trans-unit.source: In the **Allowed Tenants** list, type the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (such as `contoso.onmicrosoft.com`), then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Allowed Tenants** list, type the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (such as `contoso.onmicrosoft.com`), then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use an Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use an Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: [Azure classic portal]: https://manage.windowsazure.com/ [classic portal]: https://manage.windowsazure.com/
trans-unit.target: [Azure classic portal]: https://manage.windowsazure.com/ [classic portal]: https://manage.windowsazure.com/
